stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements best describes economic connections within the Egyptian Empire?

features.html:
• The map shows the Egyptian Empire and the following nearby geographic and political features:

    • Mediterranean Sea to the northwest

    • Anatolia to the north

    • Asia to the northeast

    • Arabia to the east

    • Africa to the west

  • From the Mediterranean Sea, the Egyptian Empire extends:

    • South along the Nile River through Nubia to Sudan

    • Northeast along the eastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea through Palestine, Phoenicia, and Syria

  • Egyptian trade routes over land are shown as follows:

    • For the portion of the empire along the Nile River:

      • Most land routes are a network that crosses and re-crosses the Nile River from Egypt in the north to Nubia in the south.

      • Two land routes go west and south, respectively, into Africa.

    • For the portion of the empire along the eastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea:

      • Most land routes are a network that passes from Palestine in the south to Syria in the north.

      • Two routes go eastward into Assyria and Babylonia in Asia, respectively.

  • Egyptian trade routes over water are shown as follows:

    • One goes along the Nile River.

    • One goes northwest across the Mediterranean Sea to Knossos on the island of Crete.

    • One crosses the eastern Mediterranean Sea to Tyre, a city that is also within the empire.

    • One moves along the Euphrates and Tigris Rivers in Asia.

choicesHtml: Merchants in all the regions communicated easily with a common Bantu language.
The cultivation of yams was common along the full length of the Nile.
Nubia was the source of Egypt’s gold and luxury goods.
Nok terracotta was manufactured in multiple regions.
